New Records: Virat Kohli reached his 48th ODI hundred.
Kohli's 48th ODI hundred is his 78th century across formats.
Mushfiqur Rahim reached 1000 runs in World Cup fixtures.
Key Match Events: India won by 7 wickets with 51 balls remaining.
Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 103 from 97 balls.
Rohit Sharma scored 37 runs and passed 250 runs for the tournament.
Jasprit Bumrah's excellent bowling display, including a key yorker to dismiss Mahmudullah.
Shardul Thakur took the wicket of Towhid Hridoy.
Ravindra Jadeja's catch to dismiss Mushfiqur Rahim.
Hardik Pandya left the field due to an ankle injury.
Bangladesh's opening stand of 93 runs between Litton Das and Tanzid Hasan.
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib Al Hasan was ruled out due to a quad injury.
Bangladesh won the toss and chose to bat.
Rohit Sharma mentioned the challenge of keeping everyone in a good space during the World Cup.
India fielded the same team as their previous match.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli's emotional reaction to reaching his 48th ODI hundred.
Concerns about India's middle-order not getting enough opportunities to bat.
Hardik Pandya's ankle injury potentially affecting India's team balance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh's powerplay performance included a flurry of proactive boundaries.
India's tight bowling from the outset, especially by Jasprit Bumrah.
The absence of Shakib Al Hasan left a significant gap in Bangladesh's lineup.
The match was played in Pune as part of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023.
